 Graduate admissions 
 Prepare to apply 
 Choose a program 
 Check the application deadlines 
 Review the requirements 
 Find a supervisor* 
 *For thesis-based programs (check your department’s requirements) 
 Application tips 
 Apply early  by gathering and composing the required documents for your application. 
 Select referees  who can provide a strong recommendation and review with them the requirements of reference letters and academic assessment forms. 
 Ensure all required documents and information are submitted by the application deadline . 
 Write a statement of purpose  describing, for example, your motivation, academic interests and professional goals. 
 Non-Canadian residents  should apply for the Certificat d'acceptation du Quebec (CAQ) and a Canadian study permit as soon as you receive your offer of admission. 
 Are you ready? Apply now 
 Already applied? How long does it take to assess my application?   The admissions process varies for each student and program. We cannot give specific dates for a decision.   You can check your application status online anytime in My Student Centre. Check your application status 
Graduate application deadlines 
 The deadline to submit your application depends on your program. Give yourself plenty of time to prepare your application and collect required documents. 
 We reserve the right to close admission to a program at any time after the official deadline without prior notice. 
 Find your program's application deadline 
 Deadlines for additional program requirements 
 Many programs have  departmental requirements  that you must satisfy in addition to Concordia’s minimum admission requirements. Additional requirements might include portfolios, auditions, interviews, letters of intent, etc. 
 You must make arrangements to submit these additional requirements with the department you apply to. 
 Please  consult the specific program page  for more information on these requirements. 
 Academic year timetable 
 The academic year is based on three terms: summer, fall, and winter. 
 Term 
 Dates 
 Important notes 
 Summer 
 May – August 
 Start of the academic year 
 Fall 
 September – December (15 weeks) 
 Regular point of entry for most graduate programs 
 Winter 
 January – April (15 weeks) 
 Certain programs accept students in January, based on availability 
 Newly accepted to Concordia? Congratulations! You now have your Offer of Admission in hand.   We’re so glad you’ll be studying here. Learn more about orientation and other ways to prepare for your graduate studies at Concordia. Resources for new graduate students
